intro: Amyema heterochroma, commonly known as the variable mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that attaches to the branches of eucalyptus trees. It lacks chlorophyll and relies on its host for water and nutrients, while still performing some photosynthesis using its remaining leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale green berries that contain toxic seeds. Its unique appearance, with leaves of varying colors and shapes, contributes to its common name. Amyema heterochroma is native to Australia and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its host trees.
